description.narrative: The Tonga-Australia Community Development Scheme (TCDS) aims to contribute to the alleviation of hardship and poverty by assisting communities in Tongatapu and Ha'apai with small grants to undertake income generation activities and meet basic needs. Funding supports a range of activities including household rain tanks, village water systems, village health clinics and income generating activities in fishing, agriculture and handicrafts. TCDS is currently being redesigned with a proposal to pilot a greater participatory planning process in the Ha'apai Islands and to seek harmonisation with New Zealand's community development and civil society assistance program. The total value of this initiative is $1.3 million over 2 years, starting 2008-09.
